body.name: Kingsons Crossbody Bag for Men & Women Small Crossbody Casual Travel Tiny Sport Hiking Cycling Day Bag
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 4 hrs 58 mins
features: SLING BAG - Versatile multi-layer design. The mini bag has a main bag, a backside pocket and a mini zipper shoulder pocket for the whole crossbody bag. The main compartment includes a large-capacity layer for all you need in daily life, a layer that fits for 9.7"Ipad pro.

SAFETY & ANTI-THEFT - Equipped with TSA Lock, the bag has some smart pockets, such as hidden anti-theft pocket for wallet, passport valuable things & an easy access shoulder strap pocket for your credit card and tickets, you can keep something useful in the front. The backside pocket keeps you from thieves and it will be convenient that you can always get your bus pass or other necessary things.

USE WAY - The daypack can reverse both left & right with softly padded shoulder strap. One crossbody backpack suits everything. We can wear this bag for outdoor activities, such as running, cycling, camping, commuting,or business traveling.

LIGHTWEIGHT DESIGN - Made of a lightweight, sturdy material, the sling bag perfect for daily use. Comfortable airflow back design with thick but soft multi-panel ventilated padding and shoulder strap padding, the crossbody bag gives you maximum back support.

FASHION & STYLISH - Stylish and minimalist design, perfect as a sports crossbody backpack, traveling daypack, chest bag, sling bag, sling backpack and commuting bag. A great bag for office, outdoors, business and other occasions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Bag - theft proof.
reviews.reviewText: Nice bag, light and plenty of room for items with compartments. With combination lock. Good product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for vacations
reviews.reviewText: I bought it for a safe place to keep my money and other accessories locked while vacationing out of the country so far iv taken it to Jamaica and Mexico honestly I love it zipper is nice.Water proof I took it thru the dunns river falls . It’s lightweight material is very nice great hang for my buck best part it has a built in wire to charge ur phone

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It’s a good bag, looks great, hold up well with light use. Be warned. It’s small. My iPad and my keys were the only thing that fit. The interior has an odd shape, so in one part of the bag it seems really wide, but once the bag is zipped up the rest of it becomes more more narrow as it goes towards the exterior or the front of the back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great bag well made.
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of these "murses" for my son and I. I tried calling it a sling bag but my daughters won't let us live it down. Anyway I love everything about this bag except I don't know how to reset the combination on the thing. Never came with the key or a instructions. Besides that it's well made strong and sleek. Better than I expected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good Pack, but with Lots of Little Annoyances
reviews.reviewText: USB Port / Battery Pocket:• The battery bank pocket is situated in the center of the front side of the bag, when having it at the bottom of the back side of the bag would make more sense for weight distribution.• The USB port itself is awkwardly positioned as well. If it were situated towards the top of the bag instead of a third of the way up its side, it wouldn’t be as much of an obstruction to the items you want to pack.• The USB cable is way too long. It only needs to be long enough to reach the battery pocket, but it’s nearly twice the length of the bag, so you wind up with a bunch of unnecessary cable knotted up and jostling around with the rest of your belongings.• The thought of an externally accessible battery bank is a nice idea, but ultimately a pointless one. It’s more stable to plug my phone into a battery that’s in my pocket than it is to plug it into a bag that I’m slinging around, and since you have to press an on button to use most battery banks, you still wind up having to rummage through the bag whenever you want to use your battery anyway. In all likelihood, I’m just going to remove the USB from the bag so it won’t be in the way, taking up valuable space and irritating me.Pack Opening:The positioning of the zipper is incredibly stupid. The bag is essentially designed like a box with its lid on the bottom. The zipper opens the back panel, so whenever you open the pack, you have to contend with the shoulder strap being attached to it and flopping around. If the zipper opened the front panel instead, the lid would just be an easily manageable flap of fabric.Gussets:As with the positioning of the zipper, the gussets make it awkward to open the bag. They’re obviously there to improve water resistance, but if it were raining heavily enough for them to make any difference, you’d already be past the point of needing a rain fly. All they really accomplish is limiting how far you can open the bag. I’d much rather have the ability to fully open the bag than the meager protection those gussets provide, so just as with the USB port, I’m going to wind up removing them.TSA Lock:No instructions for setting the lock code were included with the bag, which is monumentally obnoxious. To set the lock code….1. Set the number dials to the default code, 0-0-0.2. With a small implement such as a paper clip or a tooth pick, fully depress the small round button that is on top of the lock panel, next to the right zipper slot (you will hear a click).3. Set the number dials to your desired combination.4. Press the large rectangular button on the right side of the lock panel. The new code is now set.Summary: All in all, it’s still a decent little day pack. It’s just frustrating, because without all of its stupid design flaws, it COULD be a great one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Useful for first time delivering
reviews.reviewText: I have to use this because a purse will get in the way. I had to use a Mannequin to teach me how to wear it in front of chest. As i am always wearing backpacks on back. It takes awhile to get a full understanding of that picture and it is useful on the chest. Of course we have so many thefts in Indianapolis it ain't easy. I haven't been in that realm yet. This prevents them from stealing.

Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023

reviews.reviewText: Bolsa excelente para o uso no dia a dia, principalmente para quem anda de moto e para usar numa viagem.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I do like this bag, I bought it as a holiday bag but have used it a lot already. I haven't used the charger yet but I'm sure it will be fine, if not, I'm not bothered tbh. It sits nicely around the back, I like to have it slightly to the side to rest my hand on it and it's absolutely fine. Overall the bag feels like good quality, the lock works well and I'm very happy with it
É boa para locomoção o espaço é agradável porém para quem procura levar uma blusa, marmita e guarda chuva certamente não é a escolha ideal.
